intro: Galium penicillatum, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium penicillatum is often found in disturbed soils and can spread vegetatively through rhizomes.
